course.title: Furious Cinema: 1968-1979
course.description: Between 1968 and 1979, cinema turned upside down, radicalizing itself in all possible conducts, universally. This spontaneous, synchronized rebellion set new norms, paradigms, movements, and socio-political ethics that reshaped cinema as we know, make, and watch it today. We will survey, dissect, and admire the fury of this decade's ground-breaking movies from across the world, across all genres. Students will respond with scripts or/and visual essays.
course.notes: Attendance at occasional supplementary screenings required.
